Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Health
Channel of Delivery Name: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: BERNHARD-NOCHT-INSTITUT F_R TROPENMEDIZIN (BNITM)
Project title: Bernhard-Nocht-Institut fnr Tropenmedizin (BNITM)
Long Description: Research, teaching, training and further education as well as consulting and health care in the fields of infectious and tropical medicine. The BNITM is Germany's largest institution for research, treatment and training in the field of tropical diseases and new emerging infections. As a member of the Leibniz-Association and as a research institute of national importance, the Institute is jointly funded by the Federal Government, the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg and the other federal states. Research topics include clinical studies, epidemiology and disease control as well as the biology of pathogens, their reservoirs and vectors. The current scientific focus is on malaria, haemorrhagic fever viruses, immunology, epidemiology and clinical studies of tropical infections as well as the optimization of control measures against tropical infectious diseases in resource-poor countries and the mechanisms of virus transmission by mosquitoes.For the handling of highly pathogenic viruses and infected insects, the Institute has laboratories of the highest biosafety level (BSL-4) and a BSL-3 insectary. The Institute's health care services include specific laboratory diagnostics of tropical diseases and other rare infections, capacity building as well as the consultation of the scientific community, politics and the general public, which essentially contribute to the Institute's national reputation. The Institute has been appointed by the Federal Ministry of Health as the National Reference Center (NRC) for the detection of all tropical pathogens as well as by the WHO as Collaborating Center for arboviruses and haemorrhagic fever viruses. In collaboration with the Ghanaian Health Ministry and the University of Kumasi the Institute has been operating a modern research and training center in the West-African rain forest for over twenty years, which is also available to external research groups.The teaching activities comprise a three months full-time course on all aspects of tropical medicine for physicians as well as a training program for PhD students at the Institute and a number of activities on continuing education in topics related to travel medicine and international health. Numerous scientists of the Institute are involved in student teaching as appointed professors of the University and the University Hospital of Hamburg.

Short Description: DEVELPMENT OF THE SUSTAINABILITY STRUCTURES OF SERVICES OF GENERAL INTEREST (WASTE) IN SIERRA LEONE
Project title: Develpment of the sustainability structures of services of general interest (waste) in Sierra Leone
Long Description: Building on the lessons learned in four municipalities Bo, Kenema, Koidu and Makeni, WHH would like to cooperate with the Ministries of Local Government and Rural Development to promote the implementation of legal requirements at national and municipal level. The focus will be put on recycling of plastics and organic waste. Cooperation with investors in the agricultural and mining sector will be important, as together they will be able to absorb a high volume of organic compost. This will allow to reduce the landfilling of organic waste in landfills and will offer income generating measures.

Long Description: The project supports the vocational training of former pastoralists (women, men and youth) living as IDPs in Galkayo in market-oriented professions, thus contributing to their integration into the host community and improving their income above the national poverty line.

Project title: Enabling the Somali Red Crescent Society (SRCS) to increase Resilience of Somali communities
Long Description: The project contributes to strengthening the capacity of Somali communities to anticipate, prepare for, reduce the impact of, cope with and recover from the effects of shock and stresses without compromising their long-term prospects. In order to achieve this objective, the capacity of the SRCS to implement resilience programmes will be strengthened by implementing, documenting and learning from best practice approaches in Somaliland and Puntland.

Project title: Support to the Somali Red Crescent Society to develop a strategy to strengthen resilience in the communities.
Long Description: The knowledge about resilience among the community members of the 24 target communities isstrengthened and newly developed interventions are applied.The importance of the SRCS as a national actor in the area of resilience promotion is enhanced through improved organisational structural and technical capacity. An existing resilience strategy is incorporated into the development of future projects.

Project title: Establishment and development of self-help organizations - Poverty reduction through social structures and association-based education (Non-LDC-Part)
Long Description: The aim of the project is to combat income poverty. The project offers solutions in the field of rural development, the promotion of independent livelihoods and vocational training (in South Africa). Living standards and resilience of the target groups are improved. In addition, the productivity of their respective activities is increased. By setting up and expanding savings and credit groups, they are also able to generate capital on their own. By organising the target groups in self-help associations operating throughout the country, a contribution is made to the development.

Long Description: Strengthening the resilience of sections of the population in Jordan particularly affected by crises, in particular by creating and maintaining jobs. The target group are poor Jordanians who are particularly at risk of poverty, especially women, those who have completed school and / or vocational training, micro and small businesses, individual entrepreneurs and other disadvantaged sections of the population of Jordanian and non-Jordanian origin.

Long Description: The programme enables organisations of civil society, activists, academics and artists to find competent and creative ways to provide impulses for debates on the topics of reconstruction in a gender-democratic wax, inclusive citizenship, transitional justice and reconciliation processes, also democratic participation in public, in Syria. New networks between actors will be developed. The project contributes to re-establish social cohesion in Syria.

Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: FORUM WORLD ECONOMIC ORDER (FORUM WEO), NON-LDC-PART
Project title: Forum World Economic Order (Forum WEO), Non-LDC-Part
Long Description: The Forum WEO of the Friedrich Naumann Foundation for Freedom fosters political dialogue among political, business, scientific and cultural multipliers. The various activities of the Forum seek to achieve higher degrees of mutual understanding for policy decisions across borders. In addition, the programme facilitates the transfer of experiences for solving political problems. International experts from non-governmental organisations are involved as much as representatives from international umbrella associations and think tanks.

Project title: Strengthening the disaster risk management (DRM) structures and capacities in South Asia (Non-LDC-Part9
Long Description: Strengthened DRM capacities of the National Societies BORGS and MRCS will strengthen self-help capacities of the target communities in Bangladesh and Myanmar. At micro level, project communities and project schools benefit from improved services provided by the National Societies. At meso level, the capacities and structures of the National Societies are improved. At the macro level, BORGS and MRCS contribute to improving the DRM framework conditions in their countries through advocacy and lobbying work at government level in the interests of vulnerable population groups.

Purpose Name: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Long Description: FES contributes through its socio-political cooperation, civic education and policy advice by facilitating regional dialogues to peace and security and to the reduction of social injustice which represent the main drivers of displacement, flight and migration within and from the Middle East and North Africa region. Donor Agency: Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: SUBSCRIPTION TO THE INTERNATIONAL SEISMOLOGICAL CENTRE 2020
Project title: Subscription to the International Seismological Centre 2020
Long Description: The ISC is to advance scientific knowledge of earthquakes and the structure of the Earth for the public benefit. The principal tasks of the ISC, by which the aforementioned mission is to be achieved, are - To collect instrument readings and derived source parameters from seismological data centres, networks, observatories, or individual scientists throughout the world. To edit, preserve, and distribute the reported data for further analysis. To re-compute source parameters for each considered event, and to make available a bulletin containing original data and derived parameters. To complement the data reported by the agencies worldwide with the data obtained at the ISC by analysing available waveforms. To provide the ISC data openly. To provide other services throughout the world based on data and facilities available within the ISC. To undertake, in cooperation with institutions around the world, such Research & Development as may be relevant to improving the ISC's services.

Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: REGIONAL PROGRAMME EASTERN AND SOUTHEAST EUROPE
Project title: Regional programme Eastern and Southeast Europe
Long Description: The Regional program aims at the support of democratic political culture, gender-equity, participation of civil society in political processes and ecological modernization of economies in Eastern and South Eastern Europe (only developing countries).

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: INTERNATIONAL GENDER POLICY AND FEMINISM
Project title: International Gender policy and Feminism
Long Description: The aim is to qualify and expand the international activities within the field of gender democracy and feminism. Scope of actions shall be maintained and expanded, patriarchic power structures shall be reduced. Partner organisations will receive support for their networking and the intersectional gender-political discourse shall be promoted.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: PARTICIPATION OF CIVIL SOCIETY IN THE NEAR EAST AND TURKEY
Project title: Participation of Civil Society in the Near East and Turkey
Long Description: The programme contributes to he implementation of global social right in the programme countries - Jordan, Palestinian Territories, and Turkey. It strengthens left-wing and progressive actor sand organisations in their work and aspirations to put into practice their demands and activities aimed to maintain and create societies based on solidarity, democracy, and social, ecological and gender equality.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: SOCIO-POLITICAL COOPERATION PROGRAMME MIDDLE EAST AND NORTHERN AFRICA
Project title: Socio-political cooperation programme Middle East and Northern Africa
Long Description: With it's socio-political cooperation programme in the Middle East and North Africa Friedrich-Ebert-Foundation carries out political education and offers policy advice. Friedrich-Ebert-Foundation implements activities in the fields of strengthening democratic actors and structures, dialogue within societies and on a regional level to promote peace and security as well as promoting ecologically and socially sustainable economies. Another field of work concerns gender equality and social justice, the latter with a particular focus on the cooperation with trade unions.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: SOCIAL JUSTICE AND REGIONAL KOOPERATION IN UKRAINE, IN SOUTH CAUCASUS AND MOLDOVA
Project title: Social Justice and Regional Kooperation in Ukraine, in South Caucasus and Moldova
Long Description: The programme contributes to a peaceful and solidary society, social justice and more regional cooperation. Activities of dialogue and education take place in the Ukraine, Belarus, South Caucasus and Moldova.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: REGIONAL PROGRAMME EU (ONLY DEVELOPING COUNTRIES)/NORTH AMERICA - GLOBAL ISSUES AND REGIONAL PERSPECTIVES
Project title: Regional Programme EU (only developing countries)/North America - Global issues and regional perspectives
Long Description: The programme activities aim at critical monitoring of developmental and environmental trends as well as options for their co-managing together with other international and European partners. Another focus of the programme lies on regional perspectives and strengthening developmental cooperation, e.g. through activities in and on Turkey as well as projects in Brussels or Washington that focus on regional Trends in relevant policy fields.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: REGIONAL PROGRAMME MIDDLE EAST/NORTH AFRIKA
Project title: Regional Programme Middle East/North Afrika
Long Description: The programme promotes the political, economic and social development of the Middle East and North Africa and facilitates dialogue and cooperation between Germany/Europe and the states as well as among the societies of the region. Emphasis is put on democracy and rule of law, free and pluralistic civil society, social and ecological market economy, including entrepreneurship, as well as on the joint responsibility to work against the roots and repercussions of terrorism and forced migration.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: SOCIO-POLITICAL CONSULTANCY AND DEVELOPMENT COOPERATION EUROPE
Project title: Socio-political Consultancy and Development Cooperation Europe
Long Description: The projects as agencies of dialogue, education and consultancy participate in the European integration process, address relevant socio-political and socio-economic questions, support the interests of Germany and contribute to shaping the EU's development cooperation and external relations. Emphasis is put on the promotion of democratic participation and the strengthening of civil society. The offices' worldwide network facilitates political, economic, social and environmental dialogue between Germany and Europe, within Europe and also between Europe, the rest of the world and at global scale.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: REGIONAL PROGRAM MIDDLE EAST/NORTH AFRIKA
Project title: Regional Program Middle East/North Afrika
Long Description: The programme promotes the political, economic and social development of the Middle East and North Africa and facilitates the dialogue and cooperation between Germany/Europe and the states as well as the societies of the region. Emphasis is put on the advancement of a democratic consciousness and participatory practices, political parties and good governance, support for a free and pluralistic civil society, the promotion of a social and ecological market economy oriented towards sustainability and innovation, the advancement of the Euro-Mediterranean dialogue.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: PROJECT-EVALUATION/PREPARATIVE ACTIVITIES
Project title: Project-Evaluation/preparative activities
Long Description: Execution of evaluations and studies on the target achievement of projects and maintenance and further development of the Project Accounting, Controlling and Information System (PASTIS).

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: SOCIO-POLITICAL CONSULTANCY IN THE EUROPEAN UNION
Project title: Socio-political Consultancy in the European Union
Long Description: The EU-Office of the FES as an agency of dialogue, education and consultancy participates in the European integration process, supports the interests of 01.01.18 -31.12.20 Germany and contributes to shaping the EU's development cooperation and external relations. A special emphasis is put on the promotion of democratic participation and the strengthening of civil society. The offices' worldwide network facilitates political, economic, social and environmental dialogue between Germany and Europe, within Europe and also between Europe, the rest of the world and at global scale.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: PROMOTING DEMOCRACY, CIVIL SOCIETY AND MARKET ECONOMY IN NORTHERN AFRICA AND MIDDLE EAST
Project title: Promoting democracy, civil society and market economy in Northern Africa and Middle East
Long Description: Corner stones of the project work of the regional project for Middle East and North Africa of the Foundation for Freedom are the human and civil rights in a functioning constitutional state, the acceptance of pluralistic structures and the protection of the right to property and the promotion of private sector activities in the framework of a market economy. The objective is to move towards open civil societies which û as formulated by the Development Policy Report of the Federal Government of Germany û give people the possibility to live a life of freedom, peace and self-reliance

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes

Long Description: Lobby and Advocacy for Sustainable Development and a social-ecological oriented Transformation, Continuation

Project title: Socio-political consultation and trade union cooperation in Eastern Europe (only developing countries), Caucasus, and Central Asia
Long Description: The Friedrich-Ebert-Foundation promotes the establishment and consolidation of democratic, social and constitutional structures, a socially just and ecologically sustainable economic development and peacefull cooperation through political consultation and capacity building.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: SHAPING GLOBALIZATION IN A DEMOCRATIC AND SOCIALLY JUST MANNER
Project title: Shaping globalization in a democratic and socially just manner
Long Description: The project enables project partners worldwide in developing countries to engage in the political discourse on globalization. This should enable them to react to the social consequences of globalization. Through consultation processes and cooperation, the project promotes expertise on the interdependencies and options for political creativity.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes

Project title: Regional Project - promoting democracy, Civil Society and Market Economy in Northern Africa and the Middle East
Long Description: Corner points of the project work of the regional project for Middle East and North Africa of the Foundation for Freedom are the human and civil rights in a functioning constitutional state, the acceptance of pluralistic structures and the protection of the right to property and the promotion of private sector activities in the framework of a market economy. The objective is to move towards open civil societies which - as formulated by the Development Policy Report of the Federal Government of Germany - give people the possibility to live a life of freedom, peace and selfreliance.

Short Description: REGIONAL PROGRAM CONO SUR
Project title: Regional Program Cono Sur
Long Description: The regional programme focusses on the support of multiparty democracy, a vibrant civil society, on rule of law and a supportive environment for democracy, social market economy and sustainable development in the Cono Sur countries and in Latin America. Additionally, the programme supports decentralization processes and puts an emphasis on international dialogue about global and regional topics and challenges for Latin America.

Project title: Sociopolitical measures in South America in order to deepen democracy and strengthen social and ecological alternatives
Long Description: The programme aims to contribute via the cooperation with project partners and the realisation of own measures to the strengthening of democratic rights (especially political minorities as women, LGBTI*, indigenous people, etc.) and the search for ecologically and socially sustainable alternatives to the hegemonic economic system in South America.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: SUSTAINABLE SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE ANDEAN REGION
Project title: Sustainable social development in the Andean region
Long Description: The Hanns Seidel Foundation contributes to the consolidation of democratic and pluralistic structures in the Andean region (Bolivia, Ecuador and Peru) within State and Society. With partners from the public, private and university sectors, different educational measures for young professionals, political decision-makers and public institutions are implemented both nationally and across countries.

Long Description: The program promotes the dialogue and the cooperation on global socio-ecological transformation by implementing a just energy system transformation and by developing climate-friendly alternatives to the prevailing development model in Latin America.

Another goal is the introduction of the World Day in Mongolia.

Short Description: ESTABLISHING AND STRENGTHENING OF STRUCTURES FOR SAFE MIGRATION AND AGAINST TRAFFICKING IN PERSONS, PHILIPPINES, INDONESIA AND MALAYSIA (NON-LDC-PART)
Project title: Establishing and strengthening of structures for safe migration and against trafficking in persons, Philippines, Indonesia and Malaysia (Non-LDC-Part)
Long Description: The strengthening of social structures in poor regions in the Philippines, Indonesia and Malaysia, promotes self-help capacity and secures livelihoods. The focus is on safe labour migration, the development-relevant use of remittances and the creation of local livelihood opportunities. Social integration and economic independence of victims of Trafficking in Persons and migration related abuses are improved.

Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: CIVIL PEACE SERVICE (CPS)
Project title: Civil Peace Service (CPS)
Purpose Name: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Long Description: The Civil Peace Service (CPS) is a joint programme of governmental and non-governmental agencies. It supports projects aimed at non-violent conflict resolutions in various countries worldwide. By seconding experts, local partner organisations are assisted in the prevention of violent conflicts and crisis, reduction of violence and by securing long-term peace.
